flawed_nl_solution:
Twice the number of participants in 2018 is 150 participants x 2 = <<150*2=300>>300 participants.
The number of participants in 2019 was 300 participants + 20 participants = <<300+20=330>>330 participants.
Half the number of participants in 2019 is 330 participants /2 = <<330/2=165>>165 participants.
The number of participants in 2020 was 165 participants - 40 participants = <<165-40=125>>125 participants.
There were 330 participants - 125 participants = <<330-125=205>>205 more participants in 2019 than in 2020.
#### 205

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 320, not 330. It appears there was a miscalculation with the digits before the final zero.
